1.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to impinge, by accident or violence, or (figuratively) by importunity
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

2.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an encampment (of travellers or troops); hence, an army, whether literal (of soldiers) or figurative (of dancers, angels, cattle, locusts, stars; or even the sacred courts)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)

near, with or among; often in general, to

a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him

properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now

properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now

to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive

a female slave (as a member of the household)

an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

29.brief: to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

30.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
Penuel or Peniel, a place East of Jordan; also (as Penuel) the name of two Israelites
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
near, with or among; often in general, to
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

31.brief: properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy)
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Penuel or Peniel, a place East of Jordan; also (as Penuel) the name of two Israelites

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the thigh (from its fleshy softness); by euphemistically the generative parts; figuratively, a shank, flank, side

32.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to eat (literally or figuratively)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a thong (as compressing); by analogy, a tendon
rheumatic or crippled (from the incident to Jacob)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
the thigh (from its fleshy softness); by euphemistically the generative parts; figuratively, a shank, flank, side
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
